wikipedia_page.main: Major Sir Ralph Bruce Verney, 5th Baronet,  (18 January 1915 – 17 August 2001) was a British Army officer, local politician and landowner, who served as Chairman of the Nature Conservancy Council from 1980 to 1983.

response: The present Verney family, who still live in the later red-brick south wing, are the descendants of Sir Harry Calvert, 2nd Baronet who inherited the house in 1827. He was very tenuously related to the Verneys only through marriage. However, he adopted the name Verney on inheriting. The house was given to the National Trust in 1956 by Sir Ralph Verney, 5th Baronet. His son, Sir Edmund Verney, 6th Baronet, a former High Sheriff of Buckinghamshire, lives in the house today..
*Sir Ralph Verney, 5th Baronet KBE, DL (1915-2001) British Army Officer and Politician
*Sir Ralph Verney, 5th Baronet (1915–2001), British Army officer, local politician and landowner

Verney is the son of Sir Ralph Verney, 5th Baronet, and Mary Vestey. He married Daphne Primrose Fausset-Farquhar, daughter of Colonel Hamilton Farquhar Fausset-Farquhar, in March 1982 and they have two children: Andrew Nicholas Verney (b. 1983) and Ella Verney (b. 1985).
*Sir Ralph Verney, 5th Baronet, 86, British army officer and conservationist.
